data.question: This is my final question; what does being an idol mean to you?
data.reply: I think that just like the dancers I saw, idols are capable of delivering dreams and smiles... especially these days.

data.question: So, finally, a few words for your fans.
data.reply: Your support is what motivates us. I hope you'll look forward to seeing us as we continue to grow. I hope you keep supporting us.

data.question: First of all, I'd like to ask you a few questions about your personal life. What is the first thing you do when you get up in the morning?
data.reply: I'll take a shower and then make a cup of coffee.

data.question: Do you have breakfast?
data.reply: Yes. It's simple, but I make hot sandwiches in the pie iron.

data.question: I see. Are you a good cook?
data.reply: Yes. I've always made a lot of meals by myself. If I'm at home, I'll just cook what I want to eat in the evening, like Chinese or Western food.

data.question: Do you pay attention to your diet?
data.reply: This is the kind of work I do, and of course I try to count calories and eat healthy foods.

data.question: What is your favorite food?
data.reply: I know that's not what you said earlier, but it's pancakes... I've conquered all the restaurants that are known for good pancakes in Tokyo.

data.question: You seem to have a real passion for pancakes. How do you spend your time off work?
data.reply: In the morning, I'll go to the gym or run for about 10 kilometers. After that, I'll go home and watch a movie or read a book, which is surprisingly low-key.

data.question: You run that much even on your days off? Where do you run on your days off?
data.reply: There's a running course in a large park nearby. There are a lot of students in the track and field club that run there, so it's very inspiring.

data.question: Do you have gym or running essentials?
data.reply: I sweat a lot, so as long as I have two towels and my phone, I'm good to go.

data.question: Do you have a favorite place in Tokyo?
data.reply: I think I might prefer the nature and the old townscape to the city.

data.question: I'm surprised to hear that. Don't you feel comfortable in the city, for example in areas where celebrities often congregate?
data.reply: It's not that I'm avoiding it, but... I often go there for meetings and events, and not so much in my free time.

data.question: What are you enjoying most right now?
data.reply: Forgive me for being boring, but before I came here today, I bought some new running shoes from online. I'm secretly looking forward to running in them.

data.question: Do you have a favorite genre of music?
data.reply: There is a female photographer and editor who is very knowledgeable about this, so recently I've been listening to Western music that she taught me about. I don't have a favorite.

data.question: If you had to choose, which do you like better, singing or dancing?
data.reply: It would be singing.

data.question: By the way, what was your first impression when you heard "Shock Out, Dance!!" for the first time?
data.reply: If I could make this song my own, I felt like I'd be one step closer to the peak of idols.

data.question: How would you describe "Shock out, Dance!!" in one word?
data.reply: LizNoir's style. This is the music that you can feel it the most.

data.question: What is your favorite lyric in "Shock out, Dance!!"?
data.reply: "Don't stop dancing, we all have pain. They want to see people they'll never see again". It's very much linked to how I felt when I was going through a lot...

data.question: How did you feel about that?
data.reply: Fufu, that's a secret indeed. You can take a guess from the lyrics.

data.question: So how would you describe your relationship with the members of LizNoir in one word?
data.reply: It's probably a bit deeper than colleagues... it's more like a partner that has your back.

data.question: When was the moment you felt a bond with the members in your activities so far?
data.reply: When I'm having a hard time, both physically and mentally, it's strange to have one of the members next to me. When that happens, you can't help but feel a bond with them.

data.question: I can see how strong the bond is. Is there someone you consider your best friend in your heart?
data.reply: I don't think the term "best friend" is quite appropriate, but we've known each other for a long time, especially Aoi (Igawa). I don't know how she feels about it, though.

data.question: Do you have any dreams that you would like to achieve as a LizNoir member?
data.reply: The goal is to become the top of the idol world with these members. That's all I want.

data.question: If that dream were to come true, who would you report to first?
data.reply: My mother, who has always supported me.

data.question: Are there any problems that you are having recently?
data.reply: To put it nicely, we have a group of unique members, so it's hard to train them so that they don't have any rough edges.

data.question: Next, I'd like to ask you a few questions about idols. Kanzaki, please tell us why you wanted to become an idol.
data.reply: Initially, it wasn't for a reason that I can say here... but in this industry, it's all about winning, no matter what the reason is.

data.question: I see. When was the last time you worked the hardest in your life?
data.reply: Hmm... I've been working as hard as ever since before my debut. I work hard to make sure more people can see our performances.

data.question: What is the most important thing for you as an idol?
data.reply: I always aim for the best performance to satisfy my fans. For that reason, I pay a lot of attention to my daily lessons and conditions. Aoi and Kokoro (Akasaki) are not good at it sometimes, so I scold them.

data.question: I'd like to see the members getting scolded by Kanzaki-san. What do you think your fans are like to you?
data.reply: There's no doubt that they're the most important people in our lives. Also, our fans are very remarkable. That's why I have to stand up straight, and I can't show them how sloppy I am.

data.question: What was the happiest gift you received from those fans?
data.reply: It's hard to decide what's the best. But sometimes when I receive a bouquet of flowers, I feel very energized. Maybe it's not really my style, but...

data.question: No, no, it's a very good look for you. Then, with the phrase "I'm not going to lose to anyone at this!" in mind, what are your strengths as an idol?
data.reply: I never want to lose to other idols in terms of singing, dancing and overall performance at the live shows.

data.question: How did you feel when you first got on stage as LizNoir?
data.reply: I think I may have been trying to be strong, thinking that this was finally going to happen. When I watch the video now, I'm reflecting on a lot of things. If you think about it that way, LizNoir is evolving more and more.

data.question: What does a (live performance) mean to you?
data.reply: It's a place where you can connect with your fans. It's like a conversation through a live concert.

data.question: I'm glad to hear stories that are typical of you as a frontline performer. If you hadn't become an idol, what do you think you'd be doing?
data.reply: I can't imagine, because I ran at full speed to become an idol. But I might have still been with my mother in my hometown.

data.question: What is your favorite memory from your childhood?
data.reply: My parents' house is a coffee shop, and my mother would be tending the counter. When I came home from school and opened the door, the bell would ring. I remember the sound of the bell.

data.question: What kind of child were you at that time, do you think?
data.reply: I think I was quite a precocious child. I was tall and fashion-conscious, and my mother got mad for playing with her cosmetics.

data.question: That's cute. Can you tell us about your dreams at the time?
data.reply: I was already interested in idols. But until I got serious about it, it may have felt somewhat distant.

data.question: So let's talk about some of your school days. How did you spend your time at school?
data.reply: I've enjoyed running since those days, and I was on the track club. We competed against each other every morning and night, running all day long, so I think my competitive nature may have been formed at that time.

data.question: So you liked to run even then? How about your studies?
data.reply: I'm good at studying, I think. I was good at it, and I didn't slack off in my studies.

data.question: Kanzaki-san, you don't seem to be one to slack on anything. What's the happiest moment you've ever had?
data.reply: There was a time when I took a break from performing, but when I saw the members who had been waiting for me and believed in me again.

data.question: Then, what was the most frustrating moment for you so far?
data.reply: That was the first time I saw a certain idol. To be honest, I didn't want to admit that they existed.

data.question: I'm very curious about it. Is that person a rival of yours?
data.reply: A rival... yes, I guess that's right. It's safe to assume so.

data.question: What is your ideal image of an idol?
data.reply: Idols that will remain in the hearts of everyone. I think there are only a few idols like that out there.

data.question: What would you like to say to yourself 10 years from now?
data.reply: Is it true that you've already retired? Either way, I'm sure you're making your dream come true with all of LizNoir.

data.question: What does an idol mean to you?
data.reply: I think we need to create a space that fans can only experience at that time and place, and make them happy.

data.question: Lastly, could you give a word to your fans?
data.reply: Thank you for your support. LizNoir tends to be seen as a rather hard-core band, but we hope that people who haven't seen us perform live will feel free to come and enjoy it.

data.question: Same to you. Do you ever get nervous during an interview? I don't see you as that kind of person.
data.reply: I don't get too nervous, but I do get a sense of urgency. It's rude not to give a proper answer.

data.question: As expected Tendo-san. I'd like to ask you a variety of questions starting now. How is your school life?
data.reply: To be honest, I don't think I have a very "student" life with the amount of time off I have from school.

data.question: That's right. Wouldn't you get a lot of attention if you went to school?
data.reply: No, that's not true. It's a class of people who are involved in the arts anyway.

data.question: I see. Do you like to study?
data.reply: I think I'm the one who likes studying. I feel like I grown up when I learn something new.

data.question: Do you have a favorite subject?
data.reply: I love English.

data.question: Why is that?
data.reply: I think it's quite fun to learn English and be able to communicate with more people.

data.question: You'd like to do things such as traveling abroad?
data.reply: I would. I'm too busy right now to go, but it would be fun to be able to communicate in English with people from abroad.

data.question: Yes, it would be fun to be able to talk with a foreigner. Do you have any subjects you are weak in?
data.reply: Yes... I'm not very good at art.

data.question: I know you're often busy, but where do you usually study?
data.reply: I do it at home or in between lessons, basically.

data.question: There are some people who do it at family restaurants, but it's not easy for most.
data.reply: That's right. Thankfully, I'm sometimes approached by people, and I can cause trouble for other customers. But it's not as easy as you might think. I've never been noticed on a train.

data.question: Wow. Do you sometimes get on trains?
data.reply: Of course I do. I sometimes run from the station to the lesson studio when I'm training. But you wouldn't know if I was running, would you? Hmmm.

data.question: Is there anything else that you pay attention to in your daily life as an idol?
data.reply: I always try to be the "Rui Tendo" idol at all times. Even when I'm doing a little shopping, there's no guarantee that my fans aren't watching me. I also pay attention to what I eat.

data.question: What exactly do you mean by that?
data.reply: I always try to eat breakfast. I eat eggs, bacon, and white rice to be aware of what gives me proper energy and balance.

data.question: That's great. Isn't it hard to eat your favorite food too?
data.reply: That's right. But I don't want to limit myself too much, because it would be too stressful, so I try not to overdo it.

data.question: What is your favorite food, by the way?
data.reply: I like chewy candy. A lot of people say it's unexpected for me. And I also like the nabe we sometimes have with TRINITYAiLE members.

data.question: Yes, that's surprising. What kind of nabe do you make?
data.reply: There are no particular recipe. It's just what we feel like in the moment. I like to eat with all the members.

data.question: I feel a bond between you three. Is there any food that you don't like to eat?
data.reply: I'm not very good with beef. There are other things, but I'm often told that I'm quite a picky eater.

data.question: That's certainly an unexpected side to you. Tell us more about yourself. How do you spend your time on your days off?
data.reply: I spend most of my time training and maintaining my body. Occasionally, I have tea with Yu (Suzumura).

data.question: Is there anything that's been troubling you lately?
data.reply: I would be lying if I said there wasn't anything. It's hard to confide in others, but I try not to think too much about it because I have no choice but to move on.

data.question: I feel the strength that is typical of Tendo-san. Is there a place where you feel most comfortable?
data.reply: There is. The location.... I'm sorry, it's a secret. Regardless of the location, I feel comfortable just being together with Yu and Sumire (Okuyama).

data.question: Do the three of you ever get a holiday together?　What are you looking forward to the most at the moment?
data.reply: The three of us just happened to be together this time around for our time off. I'm going to cook a dinner at home and we've been talking about eating together. It's a small thing, but I'm really looking forward to it.

data.question: What was your dream when you were a child?
data.reply: I may have dreamed of being an idol, vaguely. I've always liked idols.

data.question: I'm going to ask you some questions about that, since you mentioned idols. Why did you decide to become an idol in the first place?
data.reply: It's strange, but when I realized I wanted to be an idol, I knew I wanted to be an idol. I think that as I watched my idols, I naturally felt that I wanted to be one too.

data.question: You're from Van Productions's training school, aren't you?
data.reply: Yes.

data.question: Did you have any difficulties during your time at the training school?
data.reply: There was a lot of them. I was floating around in the beginning. There were times when I was running on empty. But it was Yu who saved me from that.

data.question: So that's what happened. Can you tell me more about those days?
data.reply: Sorry, I'll keep that in my mind. It's an embarrassing story. The only thing I can say is that if it wasn't for Yu, I wouldn't be where I am today.

data.question: I understand. Now then, with the phrase "No one can beat me at this!" in mind, what do you think the strengths are as an idol?
data.reply: That's a difficult question. I perform with the feeling that I'm the best idol around, so I guess my answer is "idol performances"?

data.question: That's something that only you can say. If you had to choose between singing and dancing, which do you prefer?
data.reply: I like both.

data.question: Do you remember how you felt when you first stepped on stage?
data.reply: I remember it. I was so excited that it was finally going to start. Maybe I was a little too enthusiastic.

data.question: Were you nervous?
data.reply: There was a little bit of that. But when I saw the faces of Yuu and Sumire, I knew that I would be okay with them, so my nerves were blown away.

data.question: You have mentioned the two members, was there a moment when you felt a bond with them?
data.reply: There are many moments like that. Like when I went back to the lesson room by myself after the lesson was over and we all went home separately, and I went back to the lesson room by myself to find the two of them there.... Even when Yu was about to go up on stage to hide her illness, Sumire and I noticed right away.

data.question: What is a live performance for you, Tendo-san?
data.reply: Is it a place where a lot of "feelings" come together? We have a strong belief in our audience and in us as well, because we stand on stage.

data.question: Is there anyone you consider a rival?
data.reply: I consider all my idols to be rivals, not just anyone in particular.

data.question: So who do you consider to be your best friend in your heart?
data.reply: Both Yu and Sumire. We have an unshakeable bond with each other.

data.question: If you had to describe your relationship with the members of TRINITYAiLE in one word, what would it be?
data.reply: Trust. It's a relationship where we trust and rely on each other.

data.question: What is the most important thing in your idol activities?
data.reply: I'm repeating myself earlier, but you must believe in the members. Then, you need to keep improving on yourself. Oh, I'm sorry, I said two things, not one. Fufu.

data.question: It's not a problem. Tell us about music. What was your first impression of "Aile to Yell" when you first heard it?
data.reply: I thought it was a wonderful song that was very much like us. But with that in mind, we also started thinking at the same time about how we would perform in this song.

data.question: If you had to explain "Aile to Yell" in one word, how would you describe it?
data.reply: A cheering song, I guess. From us to you, and from you to us. It's a song that makes you feel that connection.

data.question: What's your favorite lyric in "Aile to Yell"?
data.reply: It's difficult to say. If I had to pick one, I'd have to say "Even in a difficult time when you feel like you're going to cry, this voice will smile at your side". It's full of our thoughts.

data.question: What are your dreams for TRINITYAiLE?
data.reply: Flying to heights that no one else can reach... I want everyone to recognise us as top idols.

data.question: If that dream comes true, who would you like to report to first?
data.reply: My family.

data.question: What does being an idol mean to you, Tendo-san?
data.reply: Idols are someone who never fail to work hard and can inspire anyone. And... someone who stands on stage with strong determination to overcome any obstacle.

data.question: That's what you are until the end. Now, could you give a word to your fans?
data.reply: Your voices are our strength. Thank you so much for your support. We will aim even higher so that we don't fail you. Please continue to support us.

data.question: I'd like to ask you a lot of questions today, so thank you for your time.
data.reply: It's my pleasure to be here. I don't know if I can meet your expectations, but I will do my best to answer you properly.

data.question: Thank you. You are very polite, aren't you?　Has you always been this way?
data.reply: Yes, I think I've been polite since I was young.

data.question: Have you always been aware of it?
data.reply: No, it wasn't something I was particularly conscious of. Both of my parents were working, and I had to take care of my sister a lot. I think it was because I thought I had to take care of myself.

data.question: I think it's unusual for sisters to be in the same office, but how did that come about?
data.reply: The reason for this was me. I had always loved idols, so I talked to my sister (Chisa Shiraishi) and we applied together.

data.question: I see. What was the reason behind you wanting to be an idol?
data.reply: Yeah, I am often asked to do things by the people around me. But this is my last year of high school and I wanted to challenge myself to do what I wanted to do. That's the main reason.

data.question: Have you always wanted to be an idol?
data.reply: Yes. I've loved idols since I was little.

data.question: How do you feel now that your dream has come true?
data.reply: I'm very happy. I knew it would be a tough world, but it's more than I imagined. To be honest, I was surprised at the amount of time we spent to prepare for just one live performance. But the sense of accomplishment that comes from overcoming these challenges is something I've never experienced before, and it's very rewarding. Still, I have a new dream, so I can't say it's come true yet.

data.question: What do you mean by a new dream?
data.reply: All of us have a dream to become top idols.

data.question: If that dream comes true, who would you want to tell first?
data.reply: My parents, since I'm causing them a lot of trouble...

data.question: If you hadn't become an idol, what do you think you would be doing?
data.reply: If I hadn't become an idol I'd probably be going to college and getting a normal job.

data.question: What kind of place is the stage for you, Saki-san?
data.reply: A place to make someone smile, I think it's a great place.

data.question: What is the most important thing to you as an idol?
data.reply: There are a lot of them. Joining forces, I guess...

data.question: Sorry... for being uneducated. What do you mean by that?
data.reply: Oh, I'm sorry. I think it was meant to be about uniting everyone together.

data.question: Thank you. What's the most important thing you've ever done?
data.reply: The first thing is... learning how to behave as an idol?

data.question: Oh, and what exactly is that?
data.reply: It's the way I deal with customers and my idol-like poses.

data.question: Have you been struggling with that lately?
data.reply: Yeah... It's possible to study and gain the knowledge, but when it comes to doing it yourself, it's not so easy.

data.question: It's true that experience is also necessary. I get the impression that you're a very diligent person; are you involved in the student council at school?
data.reply: Yes. I'm the student council president.

data.question: I knew it. What kind of school life do you have?
data.reply: I spend most of my break time studying or reading. The student council is mostly responsible for putting together hand-over materials.

data.question: You are the mentor of all the students. What's your favorite subject?
data.reply: I like practically all of them, but if I had to pick one subject, it would be geography.

data.question: If I had to pick, it would be geography. And why is that?
data.reply: I like to keep things organized. Geography and maps are very organized, and I find it calming to look at them.

data.question: That makes sense. By the way, are there any subjects you're not good at?
data.reply: Not really. If I had to choose, I'd say it's physical education.

data.question: Is that right?. But wouldn't it be different if you were dancing on a regular basis?
data.reply: I'm not that good at physical sports, but I'm not very good at ball games.

data.question: It's true that dancing and ball games are totally different. Which do you like better, singing or dancing?
data.reply: Hmm... I love them both.

data.question: Do you and your sister Chisa get along well with each other?
data.reply: We get along well. We've been together as a family for a long time.

data.question: Do you spend a lot of time with Chisa-san, even on your days off?
data.reply: We spend a lot of time together. I think I'm with Chisa about 90% of the time on my day off.

data.question: You're almost always with her. What do you do together?
data.reply: We go shopping together, we go to the movies, cook, and so on.

data.question: What do you buy when you go shopping?
data.reply: I often buy clothes. Most of the time my clothes are also chosen by Chisa.

data.question: Oh, really? Is that so? You don't buy them alone?
data.reply: Yes, but for some reason Chisa stops me. She says, "You shouldn't buy clothes by yourself, big sister".

data.question: I wonder why that is.　I'd like to hear more about that in the interview with Chisa-san.
data.reply: Thank you very much

data.question: By the way, what do you do when you're alone?
data.reply: I go to stamp rallies and I often read.

data.question: Stamp rally?
data.reply: Yes. I've always been interested in maps, and while I was visiting various stations, I became addicted to them.

data.question: Do you have a favorite place in Hoshimi City?
data.reply: I have many but.... I like the dorms now.

data.question: I see. Where do you feel comfortable within in the dorms?
data.reply: I have a place that looks like a study, and I love it. It's surrounded by books and it's a calming place.

data.question: Let me ask you a little more about your personal life. Do you have a morning routine when you wake up?
data.reply: Yes... first of all, I make the bed. It's easy for it to get wrinkled. After that, I wash my face, brush my teeth, and check my overall schedule for the day.

data.question: That's great. What is your favorite breakfast?
data.reply: I like bread. But when I'm on duty, I'm careful to make sure I have a balanced diet.

data.question: I admire that. What other food do you like to eat besides bread?
data.reply: I like kusaya (dried fish).

data.question: Oh, that's unusual. Is there any food you don't like?
data.reply: Nope.

data.question: Then do you have a favorite music genre?
data.reply: Genres? I don't know if it's a genre or not, but I've been listening to a lot of idol songs for a long time.

data.question: I'd like to dig a little deeper about music. What was your first impression of "Shine Purity" when you first heard it?
data.reply: I thought it was a wonderful song. At the same time, I felt a responsibility to sing and dance to this song.

data.question: If you had to describe "Shine Purity" in one word, what would you say?
data.reply: A song about bonding, I guess. I feel that this song brings the 10 of us together.

data.question: What's your favorite lyric in "Shine Purity"?
data.reply: "Sometimes, the dream never ends. The one who taught me that, was you". I've always dreamed of being an idol, but that part overlaps with my dream of going beyond that.

data.question: Please tell us more. What kind of people are your fans?
data.reply: They are very important to us. They make us idols, and above all, they give us courage.

data.question: So, what does an idol mean to you, Saki-san?
data.reply: Idols are a dream. It will always be a dream world for me, and I would be happy if I could continue to pursue this dream now and in the future.

data.question: That's a wonderful answer, just like you, Saki-san. Thank you for your time. Lastly, could you give a message to your fans?
data.reply: Thank you very much for supporting us among so many idols. We'll do our best not to fail your expectations.

data.question: So, let me start with your personal life, Shizuku-san. What is the first thing you do when you wake up in the morning?
data.reply: In the morning I brush my teeth, wash my face....and I go back to my room.

data.question: You go back to your room?
data.reply: I go on my phone and checking social media and idol news...

data.question: Don't you have breakfast?
data.reply: After checking my phone, I'll go to the living room to eat...

data.question: What is your favorite thing for breakfast?
data.reply: Yogurt.

data.question: What's your favorite dessert?
data.reply: Bananas... I guess?

data.question: How about a drink of your choice?
data.reply: ....Mixed juice.

data.question: Then tell us how you spend your time at school.
data.reply: ...After class, I go to the roof or the library during our breaks...

data.question: So it's a calming place for you, Shizuku-san?
data.reply: It's quiet, so. Just right for looking at my phone........

data.question: Do you have a favorite subject?
data.reply: Everything, I don't dislike.... anything.

data.question: Are you good at studying?
data.reply: Hmm... My teacher's stories are interesting. So... I try to properly concentrate.

data.question: What do you do on your off days?
data.reply: I go fishing in the sea and watch videos of my favorite idols.

data.question: Fishing is a tough hobby to get into, isn't it? So your favorite place in Hoshimi City is of course the sea?
data.reply: Hmm...I can just sit in silence. Sometimes I go with Chisa (Shiraishi)-chan, too.

data.question: So, about idols. Why did you become an idol yourself?
data.reply: I've always liked idols. And for various reasons, I joined the agency.

data.question: What do you like about idols?
data.reply: They're always sparkling... they give you energy.

data.question: It's true that when you see them on stage, you'll be energized. If you hadn't become an idol, what do you think you would be doing?
data.reply: I can't imagine.... I think I would have been going to my idol's live shows.

data.question: What does the stage performance mean to you, Shizuku-san?
data.reply: It's still a bit of a strange place to be, because I've been on the cheering side for so long.

data.question: How did you feel when you first went on stage?
data.reply: I was really scared, but we were all in it together and we got through it.

data.question: What's the most important thing for you as an idol?
data.reply: To think about the feelings of the people who are always cheering you on...

data.question: You could say that you've always loved idols. Then, what kind of people are your fans like now?
data.reply: I'm so happy to hear people calling my name at a live show... They're such important people to me.

data.question: With the phrase "I will not lose to anyone here!" in mind, what are your strengths as an idol?
data.reply: My idol.... knowledge?

data.question: You are indeed an idol lover, Shizuku-san. Have you had a moment in your career where you felt a bond with someone?
data.reply: I practiced smiling and dancing with everyone and I got to talk to Chisa-chan... there has been many moments like that.

data.question: You're all very close to each other at Hoshimi Production, aren't you? Do you have any rivals in your heart among these members?
data.reply: A rival...? I don't know....

data.question: So how about the person you consider your best friend?
data.reply: It's.... Chisa-chan. She's always encouraging me and pushing me forward.

data.question: If you could describe your relationship with the members of Hoshimi Productions in one word, how would you describe it?
data.reply: Comrades...

data.question: Do you have any dreams that you want to achieve at Hoshimi Productions?
data.reply: I want to be number one. It's going to be tough, but...

data.question: If your dream came true, who would you want to tell first?
data.reply: Who would I pick... I'd rather talk about it first with everyone... than report it, I guess.

data.question: Next, let's hear about the song. What was your first impression of "Shine Purity" when you first heard it?
data.reply: "Oooooohhh"...... is what I thought.

data.question: Ohh, how does that make you feel?
data.reply: Compared to the other idols, I'm surprised at how intensively I feel.

data.question: If you had to describe "Shine Purity" in one word, how would you describe it?
data.reply: ...Fresh.

data.question: What's your favorite lyric in "Shine Purity"?
data.reply: "The sky lit up, I saw myself in my dream".

data.question: What is it that you like about that line?
data.reply: It reinds me of... when I first fell in love with idols.

data.question: I see. Which do you like better, singing or dancing, Shizuku-san?
data.reply: Singing... I guess? Dancing is much harder to keep up with...

data.question: Is your favorite music genre, of course, idol music?
data.reply: Yes... The idols of the past and the idols of today are all amazing. I learn a lot from their live performances and their behavior.

data.question: What is your most memorable memory from your childhood?
data.reply: The first time I saw an idol live.

data.question: How did you feel the first time you saw an idol live?
data.reply: It was so shiny and beautiful. I can remember it, but I can't describe it well....

data.question: That's not true, your emotions come through loud and clear. Did you have dreams when you were a child?
data.reply: I was interested in idols....

data.question: Well, then, what was the happiest moment for you so far?
data.reply: The day I got my first fan letter.... I've always loved idols, and I've always sent them out, so I'm really happy to be on the receiving end.

data.question: That's the first time you've felt that way since you've been on the receiving end. What's the most important thing you've ever done?
data.reply: I'm always trying my best to be like the idol I've always admired.

data.question: We're already near the end of the interview. What are you looking forward to the most right now?
data.reply: I was scared of it before, but now I'm looking forward to the live show. I'm with everyone....so...

data.question: Do you have any worries these days?
data.reply: I'm not very good at talking.

data.question: What kind of idol do you want to be?
data.reply: Even by just a litle bit... I want to be an idol who encourages everyone.

data.question: That's wonderful. I'm sure there are many people who have already been given courage by you. What would you like to say to yourself 10 years from now?
data.reply: Hmm.... there's still room for improvement.

data.question: What does being an idol mean to you, Shizuku-san?
data.reply: Make everyone smile... and give them a dream to belive in.

data.question: Lastly, could you give a message to your fans?
data.reply: Thank you for your support... I'm not quite there yet, but I'll do my best, so please keep supporting me.

data.question: Hello. It's nice to meet you today. Please introduce yourself to me.
data.reply: Sumire Okuyama, I'm 15 years old, nice to meet you!

data.question: Thank you. you're the youngest person in TRINITYAiLE, aren't you?
data.reply: Yes. I'm only a middle school student.

data.question: Isn't it hard to balance your studies?
data.reply: Ehehe. That's right~. I'd be lying if I said it wasn't hard, but both are fun!

data.question: I'll start by asking you about your school life. How do you usually spend your time at school?
data.reply: I'm having a great time!　The class size is small and everyone is very supportive.

data.question: So, where is the school?
data.reply: In my hometown, Yamagata. It's a nice place!

data.question: Is that so? Do you usually commute from Yamagata?
data.reply: Yes. It takes about three hours to get to Tokyo if you take the Shinkansen (bullet train). If I'm reviewing my lessons or doing my homework for school, I can get there in no time. However, when I'm busy, I sometimes stay at Rui (Tendo)-chan's and Yu (Suzumura)'s house.

data.question: No, no, that's amazing. There aren't many people who can do that.
data.reply: I wonder if that's true. I've been going there since I was a child, so I'm used to it.

data.question: You used to be a child actor, didn't you?
data.reply: Yes. It was quite a while ago.

data.question: Why did you become an idol?
data.reply: It's for a veeery deep reason.... because I love idols!

data.question: I'd like to go into that some more, but I'm afraid it'll be avoided, so I'll move on. Do you have a favorite subject?
data.reply: I really like the music classes. Singing and playing instruments is one thing, but talking about the history of music is also very interesting.

data.question: Do you have a subject that you're not good at?
data.reply: I'm bad at mathematics. Even if I study for the test, I'm become panicked when it comes to the real test.

data.question: I know what you mean. Are you a morning person?
data.reply: I think so!　I don't need to wake up with an alarm. I'm not sure if I'm going to be able to do that, but if I'm tired, like the day after a live show, I sleep until around noon...

data.question: What is the first thing you do when you get up in the morning?
data.reply: I wash my face and have breakfast with the whole family!

data.question: I see you and your family are very close. Do you have any siblings?
data.reply: Yes! I have my onii... older brother.

data.question: You can call him your "onii-chan" (nickname for older brother). What do you like for breakfast?
data.reply: I love rice. It's really good!

data.question: Sounds good, it's in Yamagata, after all. What is your favorite food?
data.reply: I love cherries! Potato stew too.

data.question: You have a lot of love for your hometown. Is there any food you don't like?
data.reply: I don't! Ah, and as for drinks, I don't like black coffee.

data.question: Then, on the other hand, what's your favorite drink?
data.reply: I like Shiruko! That's a drink....right?

data.question: A drink, maybe? I guess they are sometimes sold in vending machines.
data.reply: Yes, that's right! It's sweet, warm, and delicious!

data.question: How do you spend your days off?
data.reply: I like to spend time with my family. I also like to spend time with Rui-chan and Yu-chan when their days off are convenient for me.

data.question: What are you going to do on your next holiday?
data.reply: To tell you the truth, the three of us will be together for the first time in a while on our next holiday! We're going to have a dinner party at either Rui-chan's or Yu-chan's house!　I'm looking forward to it!

data.question: Tendo-san and Suzumura-san both said the same thing. They both seemed to be looking forward to it.
data.reply: Is that true!? I'm so happy~. But I'm kind of embarrassed. Ehehe.

data.question: The more I hear, the more I feel the bond between you guys. If you had to describe your relationship with the members of TRINITYAiLE in one word, what would it be?
data.reply: Sisters, I guess. They are like big sisters to me. I can always rely on them and they are my two favorite people.

data.question: What is the dream that you want to achieve with TRINITYAiLE?
data.reply: Of course, to become the no. 1 idols!

data.question: If that dream came true, who would you tell first?
data.reply: My onii-chan (older brother), and my whole family! Ah,... eventually came out, didn't it? Ehehe.

data.question: You're a family-oriented girl, aren't you? By the way, what was your dream when you were little?
data.reply: Hmm. I've been working since I can remember, so I probably didn't think about it too much. But it makes me so happy to see the people around me smile!

data.question: What kind of people are fans for you, Okuyama-san?
data.reply: The source of power that guides us!

data.question: Can you tell us about your idol work? How did you feel when you first stepped on stage?
data.reply: I was extremely nervous. But when I got on stage with Rui-chan and Yu-chan and the music started playing, I remembered the memories of practicing with everyone. After that, the stage became a lot of fun!

data.question: Do you prefer singing or dancing?
data.reply: It's hard to say! Maybe dance?

data.question: What does a live performance mean to you?
data.reply: It's a wonderful place where everyone can be happy!

data.question: What is the most important thing about being an idol?
data.reply: I don't want to lose our TRINITYAiLE-style identity, probably?

data.question: What is the TRINITYAiLE identity?
data.reply: Rui is in the middle, and Yu and I are on either side... I'm sorry, it's hard to put into words.

data.question: There's an atmosphere that only TRINITYAiLE can create. What is your specialty?
data.reply: Specialties... specialties~.... Oh, I don't know if this is a specialty, but I never forget the face and name of someone I once spoke to!

data.question: That's great. I guess you could call that a special skill. Did you have to practice?
data.reply: No, it's more of a habit from when I was a child actor... I've come to remember people naturally.

data.question: That's right. By the way, what do you think you would have been doing if you hadn't become an idol?
data.reply: If I hadn't become an idol, huh? I don't think I'd have done anything at all. Heh, heh. I have nothing else to do now but be an idol.

data.question: I feel a sense of determination. Have you had any troubles lately?
data.reply: I feel lonely when I can't attend a live show and have to go home.

data.question: Is there anyone you consider to be your best friend?
data.reply: Rui-chan and Yu-chan are both big sisters and best friends to me. We've gone through so many things, and they're precious, precious friends!

data.question: You all get along really well. So what's the happiest moment you've ever had?
data.reply: When I knew I was getting into TRINITYAiLE!

data.question: What was your most frustrating moment?
data.reply: When I couldn't keep up with Rui-chan and Yu-chan, and I thought... I was lowering the level of TRINITYAiLE. I was so frustrated with my own inadequacy.

data.question: So let's hear about your music. What was your first impression of "Aile to Yell" when you first heard it?
data.reply: Amazing! I was so impressed! I was impressed that this song is for us!

data.question: So how would you describe "Aile to Yell" in one word?
data.reply: "TRINITYAiLE", that's it! Ehehe.

data.question: What is your favorite lyric in "Aile to Yell"?
data.reply: That's difficult... The lines "It's like a worn out shoe sole, it's your ticket".... and "Your singing, I want to hear it. My courage will change".

data.question: Sorry, that's good. What does an idol mean to you, Okuyama-san?
data.reply: They're like a beautiful blue sky that makes everyone smile!

data.question: Lastly, could you give a word to your fans?
data.reply: Thank you so much for all your support! I'm going to do my best to be the greatest idol ever, the one who can embrace everything when you look up, so please keep up the good work! TRINITYAiLE will never lose!

data.question: Narumiya-san, it's nice to meet you. Please tell me all about your life, etc today.
data.reply: It's nice to meet you too. Are you proud to be able to interview me?

data.question: Y-yes. Thank you. Quickly, Narumiya-san, you're the youngest in Hoshimi Production, right? Is there anything you've noticed?
data.reply: Nothing. In fact, I'm the oldest in terms of mental age, aren't I? They're all still kids.

data.question: I see. By the way, has your way of speaking been around for a long time?
data.reply: That's right. You may have heard the name "Narumiya", but I am the Narumiya daughter, you know. That's because I'm being educated at a high level.

data.question: How is the dormitory life?
data.reply: It's very interesting. Well, I'm learning a lot of things by trying to live the life of an average person.

data.question: By the way, what is the first thing you do when you wake up in the morning?
data.reply: I wake up and... well, in my case, I usually ask others to wake me up, but I'll wash my face.

data.question: You are all on duty for breakfast, right? What do you usually make, Narumiya-san?
data.reply: I've tried to make them, but after a few shifts came around, everyone around me said, "You don't have to make them," so I haven't made them recently.

data.question: So you haven't been making them lately. What is your favorite food?
data.reply: I love grilled meat. Lately, I've been addicted to potato chips, which I've never really had before.

data.question: You seem like a polite young lady. What are your weaknesses?
data.reply: "Seem like? I am the young lady of the Narumiya family! I- ...pardon me. I don't like coffee. I don't understand why everyone thinks it is so great?

data.question: Do you have a favorite dessert?
data.reply: I love ice cream.

data.question: I'm glad to see a glimpse of a typical middle schooler. How do you spend your time at school?
data.reply: This is a bit tricky, but it's okay, I'll tell you. I try to live like an idol at school. It's an important part of being an idol to interact with your fans.

data.question: So you have a lot of fans at your school?
data.reply: Yes, yes. Well, they haven't directly told me that I'm a fan, but I guess they are all holding back.

data.question: Do you have a favorite subject at school?
data.reply: It's music, after all. It's a good opportunity for me to show off my talent.

data.question: So, what are your weakest subjects?
data.reply: I don't have a subject I'm not good at.

data.question: Oh. So your grades are good then?
data.reply: That's a given. I'm always at the top of the grade on the test. But even so, I don't know why my report card is normal, it must be because the teachers are envious of me.

data.question: That's good. You're really good at homework, aren't you?
data.reply: Ah, no. I don't have any homework or anything like that.

data.question: It seems to me that the notice sheet thing has been resolved. Next, tell us about idols. What made you want to be an idol?
data.reply: I thought it would be easy to take the lead.

data.question: You came out big. What was the trigger?
data.reply: Ah, I can't talk about it too much. Now let's go to the next question!

data.question: Okay. Do you have an ideal idol?
data.reply: Of course, Nagase Mana-sama is the obvious choice.

data.question: "Sama"...?
data.reply: Yes. You don't know Mana-sama?

data.question: No, of course I know her. Is there a reason for the "sama"?
data.reply: To put it simply, she's a god. The way she looks on stage, she's just an angel that has descended to earth... No! She's a god!

data.question: I can tell that Narumiya-san likes Mana-san. With the phrase "No one can beat me at this!" in mind, what are your strengths as an idol?
data.reply: There's no end to the list of my charm points. If I had to name my strongest point, it would be my dignified demeanor. I'm very good at answering the cheers of the audience on stage and giving them an answer that does not betray their expectations.

data.question: I see. What's the thing you've been working hardest on the most?
data.reply: It's the basic training, isn't it? To be honest, I didn't understand the meaning of it in the beginning. All we could do was learn the basics day after day, and they wouldn't let us sing at all... Well, now that I think about it, I'm glad we had that experience.

data.question: I can see how hard you practice. What do you consider important in your idol activities?
data.reply: I think it's important to give a performance that doesn't disrespect the people who come to see us. Professional idols are always trying to give the best performance possible.

data.question: That's a very good answer, and to be honest, I'm surprised by it. What was it like for you to perform on stage for the first time?
data.reply: I honestly shuddered when I thought that the time had come for Suzu Narumiya's name to spread across the country.

data.question: Oh. You weren't nervous?
data.reply: I- I'd be lying if I said I wasn't...

data.question: I'm glad to hear that, I'm relieved. Incidentally, what do you think you would have done if you hadn't become an idol?
data.reply: If I hadn't become a member of the Narumiya family, I would have never thought about it. In any case, as a child of the Narumiya family, I'm sure I would have achieved some kind of great success.

data.question: Thank you. Is there a moment in your activities so far where you have felt a bond with someone?
data.reply: Well... Mei (Hayasaka) and I made eye contact and I felt the song and dance just fit perfectly together. That's the kind of feeling I got.

data.question: Oh Mei-san, you say? Do you usually get along well with her?
data.reply: I'm on good terms with her, or rather... she often gets involved with me. Whenever I say something, she laughs at me. She is so rude! Haha. I've just realized... she must admire the Narumiya family.

data.question: That might be one way of looking at it. What is the dream that you want to achieve with Hoshimi Production?
data.reply: That's a silly question. There is only one dream but to become the top idol.

data.question: Honestly, that was quite cool. If such a dream does come true, what would you want to say to yourself, 10 years in the future?
data.reply: Well, yes... You probably became a top idol and are called "Suzu-sama". You should not get too carried away, but follow the example of Mana-sama and do your best.

data.question: That's a very positive message. By the way, if you had to choose between singing and dancing, which do you like better?
data.reply: Singing, yes.

data.question: Do you have a rival in your heart?
data.reply: After all..... It has to be Saki (Shiraishi).

data.question: Oh, and why would that be?
data.reply: If I'm a little sloppy with cleaning, or if the living room is a little messy, she'll scold at once. Lately, she's started to interfere with my homework as well. Just thinking about it sends chills down my spine. She's even scarier than my mother, so she's my rival in a way.

data.question: So that's what it is. Those are your own feelings. By the way, how do you spend your days off?
data.reply: I've been watching Mana-sama performance on Blu-ray and recently teaching Mei about how incredible she is.

data.question: You're all about Mana, aren't you? Do you ever go out?
data.reply: Yes, I do. But after all, you never know where and when you will be approached by someone, so you have to be selective about where you go. I don't know where to go, and I don't want to panic.

data.question: Do you get approached often?
data.reply: Well, it's never happened yet. I don't know what to call it, but it's also an important part of being an idol to be able to get rid of that celebrity aura.

data.question: Do you have a favorite place in Hoshimi City?
data.reply: It's the same spot where we made our debut. I think it's a wonderful place where you can see the whole view of Hoshimi City.

data.question: It is indeed a nice place. Where do you feel most comfortable?
data.reply: In front of the Mana-sama goods I have in my room. Theyr're right in front of my bed, so I'm always happy when I got to bed.

data.question: So, do you have a favorite genre of music?
data.reply: Mana-sama. Her music is its own genre.

data.question: Y-Yes, that's right. What was your first impression of "Shine Purity" when you first heard it?
data.reply: I thought it was a wonderful song, which is perfect for me.

data.question: If you had to describe "Shine Purity" in one word, how would you describe it?
data.reply: It's difficult to say. Ummm.... it's impossible to put it all in one word. Next question.

data.question: I'm sorry. What's your favorite lyric in "Shine Purity"?
data.reply: "The sky lit up, I saw myself in my dream", but I often unintentionally end up slurring my words.

data.question: This is my last question. What does being an idol mean to you, Narumiya-san?
data.reply: Isn't being an idol a dream come true? It should always be someone's dream come true.... watch me, Mana-sama!　Me too, someday!

data.question: You talked Mana until the very end. Now, could you give a word to your fans who support you?
data.reply: Thank you for your support. The fact that you've just turned your attention to Suzu Narimiya is a talent. You can be proud of it. I'll do my best to meet your expectations, so I'm looking forward to your continued support.

data.question: Suzumura-san, as a high school student, how do you spend your time at school?
data.reply: After taking a class and talking with my classmates, it's probably nothing out of the ordinary. There are many students who are in the entertainment industry as well, so there's no need for anyone to get carried away.

data.question: Do many of them also work as idols?
data.reply: As you know, there's also Rui (Tendo)-chan in the year above me, and there are many other idols.

data.question: Do you have a favorite subject?
data.reply: I find it interesting to hear about history. You know, Kyoto, where I was born and raised, comes up in history often.

data.question: You're from Kyoto, right? On the other hand, what are your weakest subjects?
data.reply: If I were to dare to say it, I would say it's... English. Sometimes I can't understand what they're saying, and it's hard to catch it properly.

data.question: So I'd like to ask you a few more questions about your personal life. What is the first thing you do when you wake up in the morning?
data.reply: It's really private, isn't it? I wash my face, change clothes, and prepare myself for the day.

data.question: Do you have breakfast?
data.reply: Yes, I eat some bread and fruit.

data.question: Do you have a favorite food?
data.reply: I love croissants and fatty ramen. There are many good ramen shops in Tokyo, but there are also many in Kyoto.

data.question: Do they have a different taste in Kyoto?
data.reply: They're so rich and delicious. If you're ever in Kyoto, please try it.

data.question: Okay, if you have any recommendations, please let me know later. Do you have a favorite drink?
data.reply: A latte.

data.question: How about your favorite dessert?
data.reply: I'm careful to not eat too much, but I do eat cheesecakes and shortcakes.

data.question: What do you do on your days off, Suzumura-san?
data.reply: I don't think I would go to the gym, go to a cafe or go look at clothes or do anything special like that.

data.question: Do you have a favorite place in Tokyo?
data.reply: I often go to Omotesando and Aoyama for shopping. But when I say this, I sound like a tourist.

data.question: No, no, it's okay. When you go out, do you have any essentials other than your phone and wallet?
data.reply: If I already had my cell phone and wallet with me, I could go anywhere. This is a hard question. Hmm... maybe sunglasses and insect repellent spray?

data.question: Insect spray?
data.reply: It's a boring answer. You don't want an idol to have an insect bite mark though, do you?

data.question: I see, that's definitely important. So where do you feel at home, Suzumura-san?
data.reply: It would be my own home, after all. Rui-chan's house is also close, and sometimes we have dinner together.

data.question: All of TRINITYAiLE are very close, aren't you? If you could describe your relationship with the members in one word, how would you describe it?
data.reply: Partners in crime? Maybe that's a bit too cool.

data.question: What would you like to achieve with the three member in TRINITYAiLE?
data.reply: Of course, we want to be the pinnacle of idols.

data.question: If that dream were to come true, who would you tell first?
data.reply: I'm first going to hug Rui-chan and Sumire (Okuyama)-chan. I'd report to other people after that.

data.question: Next, I'd like to ask you some questions about idols. Suzumura-san, why did you decide to become an idol?
data.reply: I've been interested idols since I was in Kyoto, and it wasn't until I moved to Tokyo that I joined a training school.

data.question: What was the most important thing you did during your time at the training school?
data.reply: Everyone practices so intensely that it's hard work until they decide to make their debut. Rui-chan is also very serious, so it was hard to keep up with her at first. It was like, "This girl is still going!?", that kind of feeling.

data.question: If you had to choose between singing or dancing, which do you like better?
data.reply: I like both equally.

data.question: With the phrase "no one can beat me at this!" in mind, what are your personal strengths as an idol?
data.reply: Both Rui-chan and Sumire-chan are capable people. Maybe the fact that I'm talkative, fufu.

data.question: What is the most important thing for you in your idol activities?
data.reply: You must never forget to thank your fans.

data.question: What do those fans mean to you?
data.reply: They are the source of our energy. We're doing this for their support and their smiles.

data.question: How did you feel when you first performed on stage?
data.reply: I didn't feel nervous, but I thought to myself, "This is what it means to be an idol..." and then the show was over.

data.question: What does a live performance mean to you?
data.reply: Each time it is a serious battle. I want people to leave with absolute satisfaction, and that's how I feel about it.

data.question: What is the moment you felt a bond with someone in your activities so far?
data.reply: This was when I was sick and I was trying to hide it, but Rui-chan and Sumire-chan found out. I thought to myself, "I guess they get me".

data.question: Who do you consider to be your rival?
data.reply: All idols must be our rivals. It's not just us, everyone thinks so.

data.question: Who is your best friend in your heart?
data.reply: By far the best choice is Rui-chan and Sumire-chan. We've been spending a lot of time together.

data.question: If you hadn't become an idol, what do you think you would be doing?
data.reply: I can't imagine what I'd be doing. I might have been looking for a different kind of show business.

data.question: Next, I'd like to ask you about your music. What was your impression of "Aile to Yell" when you first heard it?
data.reply: We were really excited. Rui-chan was calmly thinking in her head about the song breaks and the dance.

data.question: If you could explain "Aile to Yell" in one word, how would you describe it?
data.reply: "I'll fly to everyone at any time". Something like that?

data.question: That's very you, Suzumura-san. What's your favorite lyric in "Aile to Yell"?
data.reply: I would say the whole song, but... "Let this thought fly, I'll deliver it to you straight away".

data.question: Now, let's get deeper into your personal life, Suzumura-san. What is your favorite memory from your childhood?
data.reply: It wasn't too long ago since I was a child, but I remember when I moved to Tokyo. At first I was embarrassed by my Kansai dialect, so I didn't say a word.

data.question: So you were also like that, weren't you?
data.reply: In the beginning, yes. I thought, "Don't worry about such an insignificant thing".

data.question: Were there any dreams you had when you were a child?
data.reply: It's vague, but I think I wanted to act or sing or something like that, and I wanted to be in the entertainment industry.

data.question: Do you have any recent problems?
data.reply: I'm always talking to Rui-chan and Sumire-chan about what we need to do to get to the next level as we work our way toward becoming the top idol.

data.question: What are you looking forward to the most right now?
data.reply: The three of us will be together for the first time in a while next time, so we're going to cook a dinner at our house or at Rui-chan's house and eat together. I'm really looking forward to it.

data.question: What is the happiest moment you've had so far?
data.reply: When we decided to form a group with Rui-chan and Sumire-chan. I thought it was an amazing coincidence.

data.question: So, what was the most frustrating moment for you so far?
data.reply: There were many regrets I had at the training school. It's just something that was never mentioned.

data.question: It's almost the end of the interview. Suzumura-san, what is your ideal image of an idol?
data.reply: To continue to be the best idol I can be, no matter how tough the situation is. I've been watching Rui-chan and I've been inspired by her.

data.question: What would you like to say to yourself in 10 years' time, when you will be the best idol you can be?
data.reply: Of course, the three of us are at the top of our game, aren't we?　I won't say it was impossible.

data.question: What does an idol mean to you, Suzumura-san?
data.reply: My own ambition is to not be defeated by any kind of adversity, and to be able to give dreams and hope to my fans.

data.question: Lastly, could you give a message to your fans?
data.reply: Thank you for your support. Your support gives us energy for our performance. We're going to prepare for the live show so that we can show our gratitude to everyone.
